title: 820-3115-b
message:
Computer works really slow. It is able to boot however, it can even play HD videos. History is: no history. Haven't opened the computer yet.

Any thoughts?

title: 820-3115-b
message: Run ASD EFI version and tell us what sensor is failing

title: 820-3115-b
message:
So finally back to this one, I've ran ASD EFI and it shows no errors.

Everything works except fan spinning high and computer being slow. Board looks very clean.

Fanny Software reports CPU temperature as -128C.

title: 820-3115-b
message:
First of all, try known good trackpad board/flex.
Also test it disconnecting camera cable.
Check resistance between pins 9/10 of U5511 too.
You can also try new BIOS, with clean ME...

title: 820-3115-b
message:
I'll try later new trackpad flex. 
As for U5511:
pin 9 - 0.450
pin 10 - 0.469
R5260 measures 3.6kOhms on pins 2 (instead of 4.7kOhms). Taken off and it measures 4.7kOhms. Then I took U5511 off too, but same resistance.

title: 820-3115-b
message:
I didn't ask to check diode mode (nor ohm scale) to ground.
"Check resistance between pins 9/10 of U5511"
I recently found one 2936 with 70 ohms between these lines...

title: 820-3115-b
message:
Sorry, I?ve read your post too fast (might have been late too, eyes closing). 

I will do it in the morning. Low resistance means SMC could be faulty?

title: 820-3115-b
message: In my case was PCH issue; fixed it finally.

title: 820-3115-b
message: 8.35kOhms between pins.

title: 820-3115-b
message:
Doesn't look bad.
Try the other mentioned options...

title: 820-3115-b
message: Tried complete new good housing with trackpad board/flex. Camera disconnected. Tried new BIOS IC. No change yet.

title: 820-3115-b
message:
Did you try BIOS with clean ME?
Not another chip from other board...

title: 820-3115-b
message:
I tried new clean BIOS from Internet too, no change.

If you have another file, I'd be more than glad to try it out.

title: 820-3115-b
message:
Try this file as is, don't change serial or anything else; just for test...
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1RFRVA7vkn2gGPN7hpuXlNwLCIiMrNx5G[/url]

title: 820-3115-b
message: Thanks. Tried it, no change. Fan spins fast.

title: 820-3115-b
message: Then change U5511.

title: 820-3115-b
message: One question before I change it: should I have 4.7kOhms on SMBUS_SMC_1_S0_SCL? Pin 10 on U5511.

title: 820-3115-b
message: SCL/SDA lines should have very similar value on diode mode to ground.

title: 820-3115-b
message: Changed U5511, no luck. I have around 3.8kOhms on pin 9. On another board it is 13-14 kOhms.

title: 820-3115-b
message:
I had somehow similar case with 820-2936 MLB.
Finally fixed it isolating PCH SMLink1 bus.
That was easy, removing two resistors (R5222/23).
Unfortunatelly no serie resistors present in your case.
You can try cuting off corresponding traces to PCH...
